explanation: The main aim of the Government of India Act 1935 was to weaken the Indian Nationalism. No parties supported the act. Congress rejected the act because no consent was taken from the people of India. Extra power was given to the Governor General. The system of responsible government was malfunctioned. The provincial autonomy created threat to democratic rights.
